title: Did you follow the local news this week? Take our Greater Boston news quiz.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Do you stay in the loop with the local news?
Take our Boston.
com news quiz to test your knowledge and stay informed on the latest trending stories in Greater Boston.

title: Patriots will have a ‘road warrior’ for Super Bowl LX in defensive coordinator Terrell Williams
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "He deserves the victory for this upcoming match.
So we're looking forward to getting that for him.
" Terrell Williams will make the trek to Santa Clara with the Patriots.

title: Man found guilty of manslaughter for fatal sword stabbing in Falmouth
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Local News James Blood, 43, was sentenced to 18 to 20 years in state prison and 3 years of probation.
A man was convicted of manslaughter Thursday in Barnstable Superior Court after a fatal sword stabbing in 2022, prosecutors said.

James Blood, 43, was found guilty of manslaughter and entering at night for felony placing a person in fear, the office of Cape & Islands District Attorney Robert Galibois said in a press releaseOn October 24, 2022, Blood entered the victim’s home in Falmouth.

title: Can shoveling snow trigger heart attacks? Here’s what Boston’s cardiologists had to say
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Health Half a dozen cardiologists weighed in on why shoveling can trigger heart attacks and how to stay safe.
The strain of shoveling snow can trigger heart attacks, cardiologists say.
Lane Turner/The Boston Globe ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Worcester schools closed Friday for ‘hazardous’ wind chill
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Local News All Worcester Public Schools and athletic events will be closed Friday.
By Carson Lyle January 29, 2026 Less than a minute to read .
Share ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Rob Parker: Tom Brady shouldn’t be in the Pro Football Hall of Fame
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "Tom Brady is best described as Lance Armstrong without the bicycle.
" Tom Brady and Bill Belichick won six Super Bowls together in New England.
Jim Davis / The Boston Globe Much of the sports world has been up in arms after Bill Belichick was reportedly snubbed in his first year on the Pro Football Hall of Fame ballot.

title: Activist Monica Cannon-Grant sentenced to probation, home confinement for slew of fraud charges
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Crime The former CEO of the Violence in Boston nonprofit was sentenced Thursday after pleading guilty in September 2025.
Monica Cannon-Grant was sentenced Thursday to four years of probation and six months of home detention.
Pat Greenhouse/The Boston Globe ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Joe Mazzulla: Jayson Tatum has had ‘zero setback’ in his Achilles rehab
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Celtics "He knows that if we get him back, we're just going to be a better team, and there's just no ifs, ands or buts about that.
" It remains to be seen when Jayson Tatum will return to the court.
John Tlumacki/The Boston Globe ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Drake Maye, limited at Patriots practice, says his shoulder is ‘just fine’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots "This is a game I've dreamed of playing in, so looking forward to getting out there and getting a chance to play in the Super Bowl.
" Drake Maye had no problem celebrating a successful kick by Andy Borregales inside the Patriots' practice bubble.
John Tlumacki/Globe Staff ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Former Boston Children’s anesthesiologist gets 22 years for child exploitation offenses
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Crime Christopher Sheerer, 37, was charged with multiple child pornography and exploitation charges.
A former Boston Children’s anesthesiologist was sentenced to 22 years in prison on Tuesday for child pornography and other child exploitation charges, prosecutors announced.

Christopher Sheerer, 37, was arrested in July 2024 and pleaded guilty to one count of distribution of child pornography, one count of possession of child pornography, and one count of sexual exploitation of children in September 2025, the office of the U.
